title: Machine Learning-Based Learning Process for Polymer Gas Separation Membrane Design

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary chemistry and physics knowledge, basic understanding of data science
context.additional_context: Course conducted in smartphone-limited technology environments, prioritizing conceptual understanding and application over complex computational tools

learning_goals: Learners can explain the relationship between the chemical structure of polymers and gas permeability.
Learners understand the process of predicting polymer performance using machine learning models.
Learners identify the fundamental principles and application cases of Bayesian-based molecular design algorithms.
Learners learn methods to verify gas separation performance through molecular dynamics simulations.

resources: Open-Source Machine Learning Library Access Materials
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
